Description: Fragment of Attic red-figured pottery open vase, probably a krater; glazed inside; outside male to left, his stomach, upper thighs, and part of his right arm remaining; relief line throughout.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Greco-Roman Museum, Alexandria. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1988 / Greek Painted Pottery from Naukratis in Egyptian Museums (p. 104 no. 365 pl. 78)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1134)
